Class Artillery

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • Building
        • Artillery
  • public class Artillery
extends Building
    Artilleries are Buildings (Greenfoot Actors) that only target and shoot the nearest enemy building. They will ignore all troops and do not shoot allied buildings. Artilleries shoot by turning towards their target and rapidly firing projectiles at them.
    Version:
    April 27, 2020
    Author:
    Daniel Wei

    • Constructor Detail

      • Artillery

        public Artillery​(boolean isRed)
        Creates an Artillery with the specified team colour (red or blue).
        Parameters:
        isRed - True if this Artillery belongs to the red team, false if it belongs to the blue team.

      • Artillery

        public Artillery​(boolean isRed,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 int maxHP,
                 int fireRate,
                 int damage)
        Creates an Artillery with the specified team colour (red or blue), dimensions, fire rate, and damage.
        Parameters:
        isRed - True if this Artillery belongs to the red team, false if it belongs to the blue team.
        width - Width of this Artillery.
        height - Height of this Artillery.
        maxHP - Maximum HP of this Artillery.
        fireRate - Firing rate/delay of this Artillery. Lower numbers equal faster rates of fire (shorter delay between shots).
        damage - Damage each projectile shot by the Artillery will deal to a target.

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        Act - do whatever the Artillery wants to do. This method is called whenever the 'Act' or 'Run' button gets pressed in the environment.
        Overrides:
        act in class Building

      • attack

        public void attack()
        Attack the targetted building by shooting an ArtilleryBolt at it.
